byline.contributor: Frances Robles and Alan Blinder reported from North Charleston, and Jason Grant from Mount Laurel, N.J., and Doylestown, Pa. Ben Rothenberg contributed reporting from Charleston, S.C. Kitty Bennett contributed research.
byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES, ALAN BLINDER and JASON GRANT

abstract: Profile of Michael T Slager, North Charleston, SC, police officer who has been charged with murder after killing burglary suspect Walter Scott and giving conflicting reports of incident; locals recall Slager as shy loner who struggled growing up in broken home; case has cast Slager as national symbol of law enforcement gone awry.
lead_paragraph: Michael T. Slager was just a small-town police officer, but a shooting on April 4 has made him a symbol of law enforcement gone awry.

headline.main: After 8 Shots in North Charleston, Michael Slager Becomes an Officer Scorned
headline.print_headline: After 8 Shots, a Quiet Officer Now Scorned

snippet: Michael T. Slager was just a small-town police officer, but a shooting on April 4 has made him a symbol of law enforcement gone awry.
